title: Esther Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Esther chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Esther Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Esther Chapter 5.

questions.question: On which day did Esther put on her royal apparel and stand in the inner court of the king's house?
questions.correctAnswer: The third day
questions.explanation: Esther 5:1 states, 'Now it came to pass on the third day, that Esther put on her royal apparel...'

questions.question: What did the king hold out to Esther when he saw her standing in the court?
questions.correctAnswer: A golden sceptre
questions.explanation: Esther 5:2 says, 'the king held out to Esther the golden sceptre that was in his hand.'

questions.question: What did the king promise to give Esther if she made a request?
questions.correctAnswer: Half of the kingdom
questions.explanation: Esther 5:3 records the king saying, 'it shall be even given thee to the half of the kingdom.'

questions.question: Who did Esther invite to the banquet she prepared?
questions.correctAnswer: The king and Haman
questions.explanation: Esther 5:4 states, 'let the king and Haman come this day unto the banquet that I have prepared for him.'

questions.question: True or False: The king immediately caused Haman to make haste to come to Esther's banquet.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Esther 5:5 says, 'Then the king said, Cause Haman to make haste...'

questions.question: What did the king ask Esther at the banquet of wine?
options: What is your petition and request?
questions.correctAnswer: What is your petition and request?
questions.explanation: Esther 5:6 records, 'And the king said unto Esther ... What is thy petition? and it shall be granted thee...'

questions.question: What did Esther say she would do tomorrow if the king granted her request?
questions.correctAnswer: Prepare another banquet
questions.explanation: Esther 5:8 states, 'let the king and Haman come to the banquet that I shall prepare for them, and I will do to morrow as the king hath said.'

questions.question: How did Haman feel when he saw Mordecai at the king's gate not standing up for him?
questions.correctAnswer: Indignant
questions.explanation: Esther 5:9 says, 'he was full of indignation against Mordecai.'

questions.question: True or False: Haman immediately took action against Mordecai after seeing him at the king's gate.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Esther 5:10 says, 'Nevertheless Haman refrained himself...' so he did not take immediate action.

questions.question: Who did Haman call to tell about his riches and promotion?
options: His friends and Zeresh his wife
questions.correctAnswer: His friends and Zeresh his wife
questions.explanation: Esther 5:10 says, 'he sent and called for his friends, and Zeresh his wife.'

questions.question: What did Haman say was of no avail to him?
options: Seeing Mordecai sitting at the king's gate
questions.correctAnswer: Seeing Mordecai sitting at the king's gate
questions.explanation: Esther 5:13 says, 'Yet all this availeth me nothing, so long as I see Mordecai the Jew sitting at the king's gate.'

questions.question: What did Zeresh and Haman's friends advise him to do to Mordecai?
options: Make a gallows and hang him
Send him away from the city
questions.correctAnswer: Make a gallows and hang him
questions.explanation: Esther 5:14 states, 'Let a gallows be made of fifty cubits high, and to morrow speak thou unto the king that Mordecai may be hanged thereon.'

questions.question: True or False: The gallows Haman had made was fifty cubits high.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Esther 5:14 says, 'Let a gallows be made of fifty cubits high.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Esther put on her royal apparel and stood in the ______ of the king's house.
questions.correctAnswer: inner court
questions.explanation: Esther 5:1 says, 'Esther put on her royal apparel, and stood in the inner court of the king's house.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Haman invited the king and ______ to the banquet Esther had prepared.
questions.correctAnswer: himself
questions.explanation: Esther 5:12 says, 'Esther the queen did let no man come in with the king unto the banquet ... but myself.'

medium.title: Esther Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Esther Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is hesitant to approach a difficult situation requiring courage and faith. Based on Esther 5:1-2, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God in such moments?
options: God honors faithful obedience even when we must take risks
We should avoid difficult situations to keep peace
Only the strongest and most confident succeed
God will always remove obstacles before we act
questions.correctAnswer: God honors faithful obedience even when we must take risks
questions.explanation: Esther 5:1-2 shows Esther courageously approaching the king despite danger, and God honored her faithfulness by giving her favor. This teaches us to trust God and obey Him even when it feels risky.

questions.question: How does Esther 5:3-4 teach us about the importance of prayerful planning and patience in Christian service?
options: Esther first sought the king's favor and then invited him to a banquet the next day
Esther demanded immediate action from the king without preparation
Esther ignored the king's questions and acted impulsively
Esther avoided speaking to the king to prevent conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Esther first sought the king's favor and then invited him to a banquet the next day
questions.explanation: Esther 5:3-4 shows her carefully planning by seeking the king's favor before inviting him, illustrating the value of prayerful patience and wise timing in serving God's purposes.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with bitterness toward someone who has wronged them. Based on Esther 5:9-10, what biblical wisdom can you share about dealing with anger and indignation?
options: Though Haman was angry at Mordecai, he restrained himself initially
Haman immediately took revenge without thinking
It is best to ignore those who offend us
Bitterness must be expressed openly to find relief
questions.correctAnswer: Though Haman was angry at Mordecai, he restrained himself initially
questions.explanation: Esther 5:9-10 shows Haman felt indignation but controlled his anger at first, teaching the importance of self-control and seeking God rather than reacting in bitterness.

questions.question: What does Esther 5:6-8 teach about the value of persistent prayer and trust when seeking God's timing?
options: Esther invited the king and Haman to a second banquet after initial favor was granted
Esther demanded answers immediately without waiting
Esther avoided asking for anything more
Esther gave up after the first banquet
questions.correctAnswer: Esther invited the king and Haman to a second banquet after initial favor was granted
questions.explanation: Esther 5:6-8 reveals her persistence in inviting the king and Haman again, showing trust in God's timing and the power of continued prayerful dependence.

questions.question: How does Esther 5:11-13 illustrate the danger of pride and self-centeredness in leadership or work?
options: Haman boasted of his riches and status but was troubled by Mordecai's presence
Haman humbly credited God for his success
Haman forgave Mordecai and sought reconciliation
Haman sought to serve others with generosity
questions.correctAnswer: Haman boasted of his riches and status but was troubled by Mordecai's presence
questions.explanation: In Esther 5:11-13, Haman's pride blinds him to humility and love, showing how self-centeredness can lead to bitterness and poor decisions contrary to biblical humility.

questions.question: A Christian leader is feeling discouraged because of opposition. Based on Esther 5:14, what biblical principle about perseverance and wise counsel could you share?
options: Haman received advice and acted quickly, but it led to negative consequences, showing the need for godly counsel
Haman ignored advice and persevered alone
Opposition should be met with immediate retaliation
Discouragement means God is not with you
questions.correctAnswer: Haman received advice and acted quickly, but it led to negative consequences, showing the need for godly counsel
questions.explanation: Esther 5:14 shows Haman accepted advice that pleased him but ultimately was misguided, reminding believers to seek godly wisdom and persevere in faith, not impulsive actions.

questions.question: How does Esther 5:2 show the importance of humility and reverence in approaching authority and God?
options: Esther humbly touched the king's golden sceptre, showing respect and submission
Esther demanded the king's attention without respect
Esther avoided the king out of fear
questions.correctAnswer: Esther humbly touched the king's golden sceptre, showing respect and submission
questions.explanation: Esther 5:2 highlights her humble approach to the king, teaching us how reverence and humility are important when approaching God and authority in prayer and life.

questions.question: True or False: According to Esther 5:5, Esther immediately had the king and Haman come to her banquet without delay or preparation.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Esther 5:5 states the king caused Haman to make haste to come to the banquet Esther had prepared, indicating there was a deliberate preparation and invitation process, not an immediate gathering.

questions.question: What biblical lesson about faith and patience can be learned from Esther's response in Esther 5:7-8?
options: Esther patiently requested a second banquet and trusted the king's promise before revealing her full request
Esther demanded the king grant her request immediately
Esther avoided making any request to avoid risk
questions.correctAnswer: Esther patiently requested a second banquet and trusted the king's promise before revealing her full request
questions.explanation: Esther 5:7-8 shows her patient faith in God's timing and the king’s promise, illustrating the importance of steadfast trust and wise timing in prayer and action.

questions.question: A believer struggles with jealousy over another’s success. Based on Esther 5:11, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Pride in personal achievements can blind us to God's sovereignty and lead to bitterness
Jealousy is a sign of spiritual strength
Success should always be flaunted to others
Comparison is helpful to motivate others
questions.correctAnswer: Pride in personal achievements can blind us to God's sovereignty and lead to bitterness
questions.explanation: Esther 5:11 recounts Haman boasting of his riches and promotion but not recognizing God’s hand, highlighting how pride can cause bitterness and spiritual blindness.

questions.question: True or False: Esther’s approach to the king in Esther 5 demonstrates the value of preparation and reverence in prayer and spiritual discipline.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Esther 5:1-2 shows her putting on royal apparel and respectfully approaching the king, which parallels the importance of preparation and reverence in approaching God in prayer.

questions.question: How does Esther 5:13 teach us about contentment and guarding the heart against resentment?
options: Haman acknowledged that his riches meant nothing so long as Mordecai remained unbowed, showing that true contentment is not in possessions
Haman was content with his wealth and ignored Mordecai
Resentment is justified in all situations
questions.correctAnswer: Haman acknowledged that his riches meant nothing so long as Mordecai remained unbowed, showing that true contentment is not in possessions
questions.explanation: Esther 5:13 reveals Haman's dissatisfaction despite wealth, teaching that true contentment comes from the heart and relationship with God, not material success.

questions.question: A fellow believer feels powerless against opposition. Based on Esther 5:9, what biblical truth about perseverance and faithfulness can you share?
options: Mordecai remained faithful and unmoved despite Haman’s anger, showing steadfastness honors God
Mordecai gave in to fear and fled
Faithfulness is only for easy times
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai remained faithful and unmoved despite Haman’s anger, showing steadfastness honors God
questions.explanation: Esther 5:9 describes Mordecai standing firm and not bowing to Haman, demonstrating faithful perseverance even in adversity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Esther put on her royal _____ before approaching the king, teaching us the importance of spiritual preparation.
questions.correctAnswer: apparel
questions.explanation: Esther 5:1 states she put on her royal apparel, symbolizing the need for spiritual readiness and reverence when approaching God or authority.

questions.question: How does Esther 5:12-14 show the danger of scheming and the importance of integrity in Christian life?
options: Haman plotted to kill Mordecai by building a gallows, illustrating how evil plans contradict God’s call to integrity
Haman prayed for forgiveness and peace
Haman confessed his sins and sought reconciliation
questions.correctAnswer: Haman plotted to kill Mordecai by building a gallows, illustrating how evil plans contradict God’s call to integrity
questions.explanation: Esther 5:12-14 shows Haman's malicious plot, warning believers to avoid deceit and embrace honesty and love in obedience to God’s Word.

hard.title: Esther Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Esther Chapter 5.

questions.question: What significant symbol of royal authority did King Ahasuerus offer to Esther when she approached him unbidden?
questions.correctAnswer: Golden sceptre
questions.explanation: In Esther 5:2, the king held out the golden sceptre, symbolizing his acceptance and favor towards Esther.

questions.question: In Esther 5, what is the literary structure used when the king repeats the offer of granting Esther's request up to half the kingdom?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: The king’s repeated offer in verses 3 and 6 employs parallelism, emphasizing his willingness to grant Esther’s petition.

questions.question: What cultural significance did Esther’s invitation to the king and Haman for a banquet hold in the Persian court context?
questions.correctAnswer: A strategic social maneuver
questions.explanation: Inviting the king and Haman to a banquet was a strategic act by Esther to gain favor and create an opportunity to present her petition, as seen in Esther 5:4-5.

questions.question: What reason did Haman give for his indignation against Mordecai, according to Esther 5?
options: Mordecai did not stand or show respect to him
questions.correctAnswer: Mordecai did not stand or show respect to him
questions.explanation: Esther 5:9 clearly states Haman’s anger arose because Mordecai did not rise or move in his presence.

questions.question: What is the significance of the height of the gallows that Zeresh proposed to Haman?
questions.correctAnswer: Fifty cubits high
questions.explanation: Zeresh and Haman’s friends advised building a gallows fifty cubits high, indicating a public and humiliating execution, as stated in Esther 5:14.

questions.question: How does Esther’s approach to King Ahasuerus in chapter 5 foreshadow Christ’s role as intercessor in the New Testament?
options: Both approach a sovereign to plead for a people
Both perform miracles before the king
questions.correctAnswer: Both approach a sovereign to plead for a people
questions.explanation: Esther’s intercession for her people prefigures Christ’s role as mediator between God and humanity, a theme echoed in Hebrews 7:25.

questions.question: What rhetorical device is used by Esther when she asks the king to come to a banquet before revealing her true petition?
questions.correctAnswer: Suspense
questions.explanation: Esther builds suspense by first inviting the king and Haman to a banquet, delaying the revelation of her petition (Esther 5:4, 8).

questions.question: Which Hebrew word for 'favor' or 'grace' is implied in Esther 5:2 when Esther obtains favor in the king's sight, and what is its theological significance?
questions.correctAnswer: Chen - indicating divine grace
questions.explanation: The term 'favor' (Chen) denotes gracious acceptance, reflecting divine grace working through human agency, as Esther finds favor in the king’s eyes (Esther 5:2).

questions.question: What does the golden sceptre in Esther 5 symbolize in the context of ancient Near Eastern royal iconography?
questions.correctAnswer: Royal authority and acceptance
questions.explanation: In the ancient Near East, a sceptre symbolized sovereign authority and favor, as seen by the king offering it to Esther (Esther 5:2).

questions.question: True or False: Esther invited the king and Haman to two banquets on the same day in Esther chapter 5.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Esther prepared a banquet on the day she appeared before the king and invited them to a second banquet the next day (Esther 5:4, 8).

questions.question: What is the significance of Haman’s recounting of his wealth and children to his wife and friends in Esther 5?
options: It reveals his pride and self-confidence
It is a plea for help
It is a request for forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: It reveals his pride and self-confidence
questions.explanation: Haman boasts of his riches and promotion (Esther 5:11), demonstrating pride that ultimately leads to his downfall, a common biblical theme.

questions.question: How does the motif of 'feasting and banquets' in Esther 5 relate to other biblical narratives about divine-human encounters?
options: It serves as a setting for revelation and covenant
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as a setting for revelation and covenant
questions.explanation: Banquets in biblical literature often provide settings for critical revelations and covenant-making, as seen in Esther 5 and the Last Supper in Luke 22.

questions.question: What does Haman’s plan to build a gallows fifty cubits high indicate about his character and intentions within the cultural context of Persian justice?
options: His desire for public humiliation of Mordecai
His intent to imprison Mordecai quietly
questions.correctAnswer: His desire for public humiliation of Mordecai
questions.explanation: The high gallows was meant for public execution and humiliation, reflecting Haman’s vindictive and prideful nature (Esther 5:14).

questions.question: Which New Testament passage echoes the theme of intercession demonstrated by Esther’s approach to the king in Esther 5?
questions.correctAnswer: Hebrews 7:25
questions.explanation: Hebrews 7:25 speaks of Jesus as an intercessor, paralleling Esther’s role as mediator for her people in Esther 5.

questions.question: What role does Zeresh play in the narrative of Esther 5, and what does this reveal about gender and influence in the Persian court?
options: She advises Haman to build the gallows, showing her influence
She opposes Haman’s plans, showing female resistance
She remains silent, showing lack of power
She informs Esther of Haman’s anger
questions.correctAnswer: She advises Haman to build the gallows, showing her influence
questions.explanation: Zeresh counsels Haman to erect the gallows, indicating her active role and influence in court intrigues (Esther 5:14).

theological.title: Esther Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Esther Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What significant act does Esther perform on the third day, demonstrating her courage and role in God's providence?
options: She puts on her royal apparel and stands before the king unbidden
She sends a letter to the king requesting mercy
She gathers the Jews for fasting and prayer
She confronts Haman openly in the court
questions.correctAnswer: She puts on her royal apparel and stands before the king unbidden
questions.explanation: Esther 5:1 shows Esther dressing in royal apparel and standing in the inner court before the king without being summoned, an act of courage reflecting God's providential timing. This echoes themes of divine deliverance and obedience seen in Daniel 6:10 and Hebrews 11:33-34. It demonstrates faith in God's sovereignty (Psalm 27:1) and Christ's call to boldness in prayer (Hebrews 4:16).

questions.question: What does the king's act of extending the golden sceptre to Esther symbolize?
options: An invitation to leave the palace
A sign of the king's anger
questions.correctAnswer: Acceptance and granting of favor
questions.explanation: Esther 5:2 describes the king extending the golden sceptre, indicating Esther had found favor and was accepted. This gesture parallels God's acceptance of sinners (Ephesians 1:6), the granting of grace (Romans 5:2), and Christ's intercession (Hebrews 7:25). It also reflects the biblical motif of divine mercy and favor (Psalm 84:11).

questions.question: How does the king express the extent of his willingness to grant Esther's request?
options: He promises to give her even half of his kingdom
He says he will consider her request later
He offers her a small gift
He demands she state her request publicly
questions.correctAnswer: He promises to give her even half of his kingdom
questions.explanation: Esther 5:3 and 5:6 show the king offering Esther up to half his kingdom, symbolizing total authority and willingness to grant her petition. This mirrors God's abundant grace and sovereign provision (Psalm 2:8, Matthew 28:18). It also typifies Christ as King with authority to give blessings (John 3:35).

questions.question: What is Esther's initial request to the king?
options: That the king and Haman come to a banquet she prepared
That the king spare her people immediately
questions.correctAnswer: That the king and Haman come to a banquet she prepared
questions.explanation: Esther 5:4 records Esther inviting the king and Haman to a banquet she prepared. This strategic request reflects wisdom and patience in God's timing (Ecclesiastes 3:1). It prefigures Christ's invitation to the feast of salvation (Revelation 19:9) and demonstrates human cooperation with divine plan (Proverbs 16:9).

questions.question: What does the king do after Esther's invitation to the banquet?
options: He commands Haman to hurry and attend
He immediately grants her request without question
He sends guards to arrest Haman
questions.correctAnswer: He commands Haman to hurry and attend
questions.explanation: Esther 5:5 reveals the king telling Haman to hasten to Esther’s banquet, showing royal authority and willingness to honor Esther's request. This demonstrates God's providence in orchestrating events for salvation (Romans 8:28), the importance of obedience (James 1:22), and the unfolding of God's plan in redemptive history (Genesis 50:20).

questions.question: What repeated promise does the king make to Esther regarding her petitions?
options: That her request shall be granted even up to half the kingdom
That he will grant only small favors
That she must wait another day
That her request will be denied
questions.correctAnswer: That her request shall be granted even up to half the kingdom
questions.explanation: Esther 5:6 reiterates the king's promise to grant Esther's petitions up to half the kingdom, emphasizing the extent of his authority and favor. This affirms God's abundant mercy (Psalm 103:8), Christ’s intercessory power (Romans 8:34), and the biblical principle of generous grace (Luke 6:38).

questions.question: What is the nature of Esther’s petition at the second banquet?
options: She requests that the king and Haman attend a second banquet the following day
She asks for wealth and power
She requests to be queen no longer
questions.correctAnswer: She requests that the king and Haman attend a second banquet the following day
questions.explanation: Esther 5:8 shows Esther inviting the king and Haman to a second banquet, indicating a wise, measured approach aligned with God's timing (Ecclesiastes 8:5). This reflects patience, planning, and reliance on God’s providence (Proverbs 3:5-6), consistent with biblical wisdom literature.

questions.question: How does Haman react when he sees Mordecai at the king's gate, and what does this reveal about human sin nature?
options: He feels indignation because Mordecai does not stand or move for him
He ignores Mordecai and feels pity
questions.correctAnswer: He feels indignation because Mordecai does not stand or move for him
questions.explanation: Esther 5:9 depicts Haman’s wrath at Mordecai’s refusal to honor him, revealing pride and envy rooted in sin (James 4:6). This reflects human tendencies toward wrath and self-exaltation contrasted with humility (Proverbs 16:18; Galatians 5:20). It also recalls biblical warnings against resentment (Ephesians 4:31).

questions.question: What does Haman do after restraining his anger toward Mordecai?
options: He calls for his friends and wife to share his grievances
He immediately goes to the king to accuse Mordecai
He decides to honor Mordecai publicly
He leaves the city in despair
questions.correctAnswer: He calls for his friends and wife to share his grievances
questions.explanation: Esther 5:10 shows Haman confiding in his friends and wife, illustrating how sin often escalates through counsel and conspiracy (Proverbs 1:10-16). It reflects the biblical theme of evil plans being plotted in secret (Psalm 64:2) and contrasts with godly counsel (Proverbs 11:14).

questions.question: What does Haman boast about in his conversation with his friends and wife?
options: His riches, children, and high royal promotion
His humility and service to the king
His desire for reconciliation with Mordecai
questions.correctAnswer: His riches, children, and high royal promotion
questions.explanation: Esther 5:11 describes Haman boasting of his wealth, family, and status, revealing the sin of pride and self-reliance (Proverbs 16:18). This contrasts with biblical calls to humility (Micah 6:8) and dependence on God rather than earthly glory (1 Timothy 6:17).

questions.question: Despite all his achievements, what troubles Haman deeply?
options: Seeing Mordecai the Jew sitting at the king's gate
The queen's favor toward the king
questions.correctAnswer: Seeing Mordecai the Jew sitting at the king's gate
questions.explanation: Esther 5:13 reveals Haman’s distress over Mordecai’s refusal to bow, highlighting how sin blinds to true honor and causes envy (Romans 1:21). It echoes biblical themes of God’s exaltation of the humble and the downfall of the proud (Luke 1:52-53; James 4:10).

questions.question: What solution do Zeresh and Haman's friends propose for dealing with Mordecai?
options: Building a gallows to hang Mordecai
Asking the king to exile Mordecai
questions.correctAnswer: Building a gallows to hang Mordecai
questions.explanation: Esther 5:14 shows Zeresh advising Haman to build a gallows to execute Mordecai, illustrating the destructive power of sin and vengeance (Romans 12:19). This reflects biblical warnings against wicked plots (Psalm 37:1-2) and God’s justice against evil (Nahum 1:3).

questions.question: What is the significance of the gallows being fifty cubits high in the narrative?
options: It symbolizes an extreme and public display of judgment
It was the standard height for gallows
It was meant to be hidden from the king
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes an extreme and public display of judgment
questions.explanation: Esther 5:14's reference to a fifty cubit gallows indicates an exaggerated, public execution symbolizing Haman’s desire to make an example of Mordecai. This aligns with biblical motifs of public justice (Deuteronomy 21:22-23) and warnings against prideful displays (Proverbs 25:27).

questions.question: How does Esther 5 illustrate the theme of divine providence in human affairs?
options: Through Esther's courageous approach leading to the king’s favor and the unfolding plan against Haman
Through immediate punishment of Esther for disobedience
Through Haman's successful plot against Mordecai
Through the king ignoring Esther’s request
questions.correctAnswer: Through Esther's courageous approach leading to the king’s favor and the unfolding plan against Haman
questions.explanation: Esther 5 demonstrates God's providence as Esther’s boldness leads to favor and the unfolding of justice against Haman. This reflects God's sovereign control (Proverbs 21:1), as seen in Joseph’s rise (Genesis 50:20), Daniel’s protection (Daniel 6), and Christ’s redemptive mission (Acts 2:23).

questions.question: What does Esther’s interaction with the king reveal about the nature of intercession?
options: It shows the necessity of courage, timing, and favor to advocate for others
It demands immediate confrontation without preparation
It involves coercing the king by threats
It is ineffective without public support
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the necessity of courage, timing, and favor to advocate for others
questions.explanation: Esther 5 illustrates intercession requiring courage and divine favor, paralleling biblical examples like Moses (Exodus 32:11-14), Abraham (Genesis 18:23-33), and Christ as our mediator (1 Timothy 2:5). It teaches reliance on God’s timing (Ecclesiastes 3:1) and grace (Hebrews 4:16).
